message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.CV. 

The paper proposes a framework for Collective Classification (CC) using graph convolutional filters that exploit attribute and label information available in the neighborhood. This falls under the broad category of machine learning and specifically, graph neural networks. The paper also evaluates the proposed framework on 11 datasets from different domains, indicating a focus on practical applications. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). The paper also deals with graph data structures, which suggests a possible fit with cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.CV (Computer Vision) if the datasets involve image data.
